items.title: Exercise 1: Internal Memo (Doc A)
items.text:
Doc A — Internal Memo: Potential Data Breach

To: All Administrative Staff
From: Data Protection Officer (DPO)
Subject: Urgent: Incident Report #882

It has been reported that an email containing Personally Identifiable Information (PII) was accidentally sent to an external vendor yesterday at 4:15 PM. The attachment is believed to have contained the names, home addresses, and payroll IDs of 15 employees.

Action taken so far:
- The sender has attempted to recall the email.
- The vendor has been contacted and asked to delete the message immediately without opening the attachment.
- It is expected that a full impact assessment will be completed by Tuesday morning.

Please remember that under GDPR, any serious breach must be reported to the regulator within 72 hours. All staff are reminded to exercise due diligence when handling sensitive data.

questions.question: What kind of information was contained in the accidentally sent email?
questions.explanation: Doc A mentions the email contained PII, specifically names, addresses, and payroll IDs.

questions.question: Within what timeframe must a serious breach be reported to the regulator under GDPR?
questions.explanation: Doc A states: 'under GDPR, any serious breach must be reported to the regulator within 72 hours.'

items.prompt: Exercise 2: GDPR Principles. Which principle states that you should only collect the data that is 'absolutely necessary'?
items.explanation: Data Minimisation means only collecting data that is absolutely necessary for the task.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Breach Protocol. What is the correct sequence for the GDPR Action Protocol?
items.explanation: The protocol follows the logic: 1. Identify, 2. Contain, 3. Assess, 4. Notify.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Privacy Vocabulary. Complete the sentence: 'Before sharing the document, we must ___ any sensitive bank details to ensure ___.'
items.explanation: 'Redact' means to remove sensitive info, ensuring 'confidentiality'.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: Complex Passives. Rewrite this sentence using a complex passive structure (It + is + reported/thought + that...) to make it more objective: 'The intern lost the USB stick.'
items.modelAnswer: It is reported that the USB stick has been lost.

items.prompt: Exercise 6: GDPR Checklist. List the 5 core principles of GDPR mentioned in the theory.
items.modelAnswer:
1. Lawfulness, Fairness, and Transparency
2. Purpose Limitation
3. Data Minimisation
4. Storage Limitation
5. Integrity and Confidentiality

items.prompt: Exercise 7: Extracting Action Points. Based on Doc A, list the 3 actions that have been taken so far regarding the breach.
items.modelAnswer:
1. Recalled the email.
2. Contacted vendor to delete message.
3. Scheduled impact assessment for Tuesday.

items.prompt: Exercise 8: Courtesy Modals. Which is the most professional way to ask a colleague to speed up a Subject Access Request (SAR)?
options: Could you please confirm the status of the SAR, as the 30-day deadline is approaching?
Why is the SAR not done yet?
items.explanation: This option uses a polite modal ('Could you...') and provides a professional reason (the deadline).

items.prompt: Exercise 9: Follow-up Email. Write a short email (40-60 words) to the IT department asking for the encryption status of the new shared drive.
items.modelAnswer: Hi IT team, I’m writing to check whether the new shared drive is now fully encrypted. We need to ensure we are in compliance with our data security policy before we migrate any PII. Could you please confirm by the end of the day? Thanks, [Your Name]

items.prompt: Exercise 10: SAR Timeframe. What is the standard legal timeframe for an organisation to respond to a Subject Access Request (SAR)?
items.explanation: The standard timeframe for a SAR is usually 30 days.

items.prompt: Exercise 11: Oral Briefing Prep. Prepare a script for a 3-minute briefing to a new employee about 'Data Minimisation'. Explain what it is and why it matters for administrative tasks.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Rubric: Clarity, Use of Key Terms (PII, compliance), Professional Tone.

items.prompt: Exercise 12: Oral Breach Reporting. Record a 90-second audio reporting a lost laptop to your DPO. Use complex passives (e.g., 'The laptop is believed to have been...').
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Checklist: Complex passives, Action Protocol (Contain/Assess), Professionalism.

items.prompt: Exercise 13: Data Privacy Audit (Portfolio). Write a 150-word report on a privacy risk in your office (e.g., passwords on screens). Use at least two complex passive structures.
items.modelAnswer:
Subject: Data Privacy Mini-Audit - Reception Area

It was observed during a recent walkthrough that several passwords are being kept on sticky notes attached to monitors. It is thought that this poses a significant security risk, as unauthorised visitors could easily access sensitive systems.

Furthermore, the filing cabinet in the corridor is believed to have been left unlocked on several occasions. It is expected that all staff will now receive refresher training on GDPR 'Integrity and Confidentiality' principles.

Recommendations:
1. Implement a clear-desk policy immediately.
2. Replace manual locks with electronic key-card access to ensure we are in compliance with current regulations.

items.prompt: Exercise 14: SAR Log Template. Complete a log entry for a Subject Access Request. Include: Request Date, Data Subject, Description of Data Requested, and Deadline.
items.modelAnswer: Request Date: 12th Oct. Data Subject: Jane Doe. Description: All email correspondence regarding her 2023 contract. Deadline: 11th Nov (30 days).

items.prompt: Exercise 15: Weekly Mini-test. 1) What does PII stand for? 2) How many hours do you have to notify the regulator of a breach? 3) Define 'Redaction'. 4) Complete: 'Subject + is + believed + to + ___'.
items.modelAnswer: 1) Personally Identifiable Information. 2) 72 hours. 3) Removing sensitive information from a document. 4) ...have been compromised (or any valid infinitive).
